results.title: Wonder Dog
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales of Pluto”.
Pluto tries to impress his girlfriend by impersonating a circus dog. The feats he must perform, however, prove to be much trickier than he expected.

results.title: Sam Weller and his father
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
Shows Sam Weller and his father collaborating on a plan to get Mr Pickwick out of the debtor’s prions and finally managing to give the detestable Mr Stiggins, a lay preacher, a sharp lesson. From the series “Tales from Dickens.”

results.title: The Runaways
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
A tale of childhood romance about the 9-year-old Harry Walmers and his fiance, both guests at the Holly Tree Inn, who elope with the help fo the hostess, Mrs Piff, Boots and the other servants. Introductor narration filmed in Dickens’ home.

results.title: Pluto's surprise package
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales of Pluto”.
A Disney animation film about a surprise package for Pluto. On opening the package, Pluto discovers that it contains a lovable irrepressible tortoise.

results.title: The Old soldier
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
An excerpt from Charles Dickens’ “David Copperfield”. A crisis in the lives of Dr Strong and his young wife Annie is brought about by the selfishness and thoughtless interference of Annie’s mother, “the old soldier”, and the malicious manoeuvrings of Uriah Heep. How this misunderstanding develops and how it is cleared up with David Copperfield’s help is told.

results.title: Mr Jingle at Dingley Dell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
On their way to Dingley Dell, Mr Pickwick and his friends meet the rascally Alfred Jingle, with his unusual telegraphic style of speech. Tells how Jingle hoodwinks them all, ingratiates himself with Miss Rachel Wardell, elopes with her in the middle of the night, and is finally apprehended by Mr Pickwick. Adapted from Charles Dickens “The Pickwick Papers”. Narrated by Fredric March.

results.title: The Hoffnung symphony orchestra
results.creator_credit: Harold Whitaker, John Halas, BBC-TV and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Hoffnung”.
A light hearted look at the various instruments of the orchestra, based on the original cartoons of the late Gerard Hoffung, satirising musical pomposity. The music was composed and conducted by Francis Chagrin, who collaborated with Hoffnung on many occasions.
